definition: laser (loanword)/Taiwanese term for 激光[ji1 guang1]

sentences.english: In 1898 they discovered polonium and radium.
The camp was guarded by armed soldiers and ringed with high fences and rolls of razor wire.
sentences.chinese: 武装守卫的营地由高高的栅栏隔离并绕满了镭射线。

sentences.english: Unlike many, however, Curie felt her place was in Paris. After the radium was in a Bordeaux safe-deposit box, she returned to Paris on a military train.
sentences.chinese: 在镭安全抵达波多尔市后，她乘军用火车回到了巴黎。

sentences.english: The Curies are best known for discovering radium.
sentences.chinese: 居里夫妇最为出名的是发现了镭。

sentences.english: Shah Rukh, who is busy shooting for his forthcoming film "Ra."
sentences.chinese: 沙鲁克，谁是他即将上映的影片“镭忙拍。

sentences.english: Madame Curie devoted all her time to the study of radium.
sentences.chinese: 居里夫人一生致力于镭的研究。

sentences.english: Tile in the main source of radon emitted by radium.
sentences.chinese: 瓷砖中所放射出来的氡主要来源镭。

sentences.english: It was an electroscope which contained a small amount of radium.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个验电器，其中载有少量的镭。

sentences.english: Madame Curie discovered the element radium.
sentences.chinese: 居里夫人发现了镭元素。

sentences.english: The  radiation  radius of the  radioactive  radium  radiator in the  stadium is  variable.
sentences.chinese: 放射性的镭暖气装置的辐射半径在体育场是易变的。

sentences.english: It was Madame Curie who discovered the element radium.
sentences.chinese: 是居里夫人发现了镭元素。

sentences.english: Radium can be used to treat cancer.
The matter that the Curies had discovered was radium.
sentences.chinese: 居里夫妇发现的物质正是镭。

definition: deuterium 2H/heavy hydrogen, isotope of hydrogen having 1 neutron in its nucleus, so atomic weight 2
tritium 3H/radioactive isotope of hydrogen having 2 neutrons in its nucleus, so atomic weight 3
